attractions.name: Cranbrook History Centre
attractions.description: A museum showcasing the history of rail travel and the Cranbrook area with an impressive collection of vintage locomotives.

attractions.name: Fort Steele Heritage Town
attractions.description: An authentic pioneer town from the 1890s, offering a living history experience with restored buildings and costumed interpreters.

attractions.name: Cranbrook Community Forest
attractions.description: A vast network of trails perfect for hiking, mountain biking, and snowshoeing, with stunning views of the surrounding mountains.

attractions.name: Fisher Peak
attractions.description: The highest peak in the southern Rockies, a popular destination for experienced hikers seeking a challenging ascent and breathtaking views.

attractions.name: St. Eugene Golf Resort
attractions.description: A luxury resort with a world-class golf course and a casino, set in a beautifully restored historic residential school building.

attractions.name: Jim Smith Lake Provincial Park
attractions.address: Jim Smith Lake Rd, Cranbrook, BC
attractions.description: A tranquil park with a small, warm lake perfect for swimming, canoeing, and picnics during the summer months.

attractions.name: The Elizabeth Lake Sanctuary
attractions.description: A serene wetland area and wildlife sanctuary, known for its boardwalk trails and excellent bird watching opportunities.

attractions.name: Key City Theatre
attractions.description: The premier venue for live entertainment in the East Kootenay region, hosting a variety of concerts, plays, and events.
